summary: This is an email chain from November 30, 2018, between individuals with US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) email addresses. The emails discuss a memo related to Epstein, coordination with the FBI regarding an old case file review, and a need to respond to a New York Times article. The tone suggests internal government coordination on the Epstein case.

events.title: Internal US Attorney's Office Coordination on Epstein
events.description: Email exchange among US Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing a memo on Epstein, FBI review of an old case file, and a New York Times article, with plans to meet.

keyFacts: The US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) was actively discussing the Epstein case internally via email on November 30, 2018.
The FBI was in the process of pulling and reviewing an old Epstein case file at the request of the SDNY.
A New York Times article published that day prompted internal discussion about how the office should publicly respond or 'put down our marker.'
The emails indicate preparation of a memo on Epstein-related issues for internal review and circulation.
